services
Class SocialStateLearningService

java.lang.Object
  services.SocialStateLearningService

public class SocialStateLearningService
extends java.lang.Object

This service provides the API for (Social State Learning) as described in the MobiSoc paper/documentation. Due to restrictions imposed by KSOAP on the type of dataobects that can be exchanged, for ceratin methods we provide two versions of the API. One that works with KSOAP and the other one works generally. If we do not provide a specific KSOAP version, then the method works with KSOAP as well as in the general case

Author:
Maverick

getAffinityMatrix

public java.util.Vector getAffinityMatrix(java.lang.Long userid1,
                                          java.lang.Long userid2)
This is KSOAP compatible wrapper for main API. This function returns an affinity matrix between two users based on several matching factors

Parameters:
userId1 - User Id for the first user
userId2 - User Id for the second user
Returns:
Vector of objects (KVMAffinityMatrixElement) representing matching elements and thier match scores. Note that match scores are strings instead of doubles due to KSOAP restrictions

This API is used to get common interest between two users

Parameters:
id1 - User Id of the first person whose interest list we are going to consider.
id2 - User Id of the second person whose interest list we are going to consider.
Returns:
A String array with all the intersections between the interests of id1 and id2.

getCopresenceHistory

public java.util.Vector getCopresenceHistory(java.lang.Long userIdOne,
                                             java.lang.Long userIdTwo,
                                             java.lang.Long searchStartDate,
                                             java.lang.Long searchEndDate)
This is the KSOAP compatible version of getCopresenceHistory. This function returns the co-presence history between two users in a given time frame. It returns a vector of placeid, starttime and endtime. The placeid is the smallest place where co-presence occured. ie if the users were copresent at a building inside a campus then the placeid will return the building. There are important (pre-requisites) before using this API. The query is based on the assumtion that the placeid of the building is greater than that of it's parent. Also it assumes that the function "extractCopresentUsers" from the data mining service has already been invoked with the userid as the first user.

Parameters:
userIdOne - User Id for the first user
userIdTwo - User Id for the second user
searchStartDate - Search start time (converted to milliseconds from a timestamp object)
searchEndDate - Search end time (converted to milliseconds from timestamp object)
Returns:
A vector that contains the several objects of class KVMCopresenceHistory. Each object represents a copresence instance with placeid, starttime and endtime The starttime and endtime are given in milliseconds (converted from timestamp object)

getCopresenceHistory

public java.util.Vector getCopresenceHistory(long userIdOne,
                                             long userIdTwo,
                                             long searchStartDate,
                                             long searchEndDate)
This function returns the co-presence history between two users in a given time frame. It returns a vector of placeid, starttime and endtime. The placeid is the smallest place where co-presence occured. ie if the users were copresent at a building inside a campus then the placeid will return the building. There are important (pre-requisites) before using this API. The query is based on the assumtion that the placeid of the building is greater than that of it's parent. Also it assumes that the function "extractCopresentUsers" from the data mining service has already been invoked with the userid as the first user.

Parameters:
userIdOne - User Id for the first user
userIdTwo - User Id for the second user
searchStartDate - Search start time (converted to milliseconds from a timestamp object)
searchEndDate - Search end time (converted to milliseconds from timestamp object)
Returns:
A vector that contains the several objects of class copresenceHistory. Each object represents a copresence instance with placeid, starttime and endtime

getUserSocialGroupsAtPlace

public java.util.Vector<java.lang.Long> getUserSocialGroupsAtPlace(java.lang.Long placeId,
                                                                   java.lang.Long userId)
This function returns a user's social groups associated with the given place. It searches for groups that are associated with a place or a subplace of that place (upto one level). This function can be modified to search for places more that one level.

Parameters:
placeId - Place Id for the place where groups are to be searched
userId - User Id for the user whose gropus ar to be searched
Returns:
Returns a vector of group id's (Long) for the social groups at place

Returns:
Returns a vector of group id's (Long) for the social groups at place

getUserPlaceHistory

public java.util.Vector getUserPlaceHistory(java.lang.Long userId,
                                            java.lang.Long placeId,
                                            java.lang.Long searchStartDate,
                                            java.lang.Long searchEndDate)
This is the KSOAP compatible wrapper for the getUserPlaceHistory method This function returns the various vists by a user at a given place in a given period. It returns a vector that contains the placeid, starttime and endtime for each visit. Note here that the placeid for each visit is a user specific placeid and not the general placeid that we assign to places. We asign user speicific place id's to all significant places for a user. This is used to account for the fact that the user might have more than one significant places inside a system defined places. For example a student might have more than one significant places inside his department building. Impotantly before using this API, the "extractPlaces" API from the DataMining service should be invoked for the given uer betwen the given time frame.

Parameters:
userId - User Id for the user whose visits are to be detected
placeId - Place Id for the place where user visits are to be detected
searchStartDate - Search start date in milliseconds (converted from timestamp object)
searchEndDate - Search end date in milliseconds (converted from timestamp object)
Returns:
This function returns a vector that contains the visit startTime an endTime for every visit. Addtionally for each visit, it contains a user-specific place id. The information is contained inside a UserPlaceHistory object.

getUserPlaceHistory

public java.util.Vector getUserPlaceHistory(long userId,
                                            long placeId,
                                            long searchStartDate,
                                            long searchEndDate)
This function returns the various vists by a user at a given place in a given period. It returns a vector that contains the placeid, starttime and endtime for each visit. Note here that the placeid for each visit is a user specific placeid and not the general placeid that we assign to places. We asign user speicif place id's to all significant places for a user. This is used to account for the fact that the user might have more than one significant places inside a system defined places. For example a student might have more than one significant places inside his department building. Impotantly before using this API, the "extractPlaces" API from the DataMining service should be invoked for the given uer betwen the given time frame.

Parameters:
userId - User Id for the user whose visits are to be detected
placeId - Place Id for the place where user visits are to be detected
searchStartDate - Search start date in milliseconds (converted from timestamp object)
searchEndDate - Search end date in milliseconds (converted from timestamp object)
Returns:
This function returns a vector that contains the visit startTime an endTime for every visit Addtionally for each visit, it contains a user-specific place id. The information is contained inside a UserPlaceHistory object.

getPlaceAttendancePatterns

public java.util.Vector getPlaceAttendancePatterns(java.lang.Long placeId,
                                                   java.lang.Long searchStartDate,
                                                   java.lang.Long searchEndDate,
                                                   java.lang.Long startHour,
                                                   java.lang.Long endHour)
This function returns a vector that contains the number of people that visited a place for each day between a given time period. Each entry in the vector represent the number of people for each day within the time frame. The time frame is specified by the start time and the end time Addtionally you can optionally specify the hours of the day in which to do the search given by startHour and endHour. This function assumes that the time period that you specify will be within a particular year. Therefore your time period cannot span two or more different years.

Parameters:
placeId - Place Id for the place where attendance pattern is to be searched
searchStartDate - Start date for search in milliseconds (converted from timestamp object)
searchEndDate - End date for search in milliseconds (converted from timestamp object)
startHour - Start hour for search
endHour - End hour for search
Returns:
Vector that contains the number of people at the place (Long) for each day from start date and end time (inclusive) and also start hour and end hour (inclusive)

getPlaceAttendancePatterns

public java.util.Vector getPlaceAttendancePatterns(java.lang.Long placeId,
                                                   java.lang.Long searchStartDate,
                                                   java.lang.Long searchEndDate)
This function returns a vector that contains the number of people that visited a place for each day between a given time period. Each entry in the vector represent the number of people for each day within the time frame. The time frame is specified by the start time and the end time. This function assumes that the time period that you specify will be within a particular year. Therefore your time period cannot span two or more different years.

Parameters:
placeId - Place Id for the place where aatttendance pattern is to be searched
searchStartDate - Start date for search in milliseconds (converted from timestamp object)
searchEndDate - End date for search in milliseconds (converted from timestamp object)
startHour - Start hour for search
endHour - End hour for search
Returns:
Vector that contains the number of people at the place (Long) for each day from start date and end time (inclusive)

getSocialEventsPlaceHistory

public java.util.Vector<java.lang.Long> getSocialEventsPlaceHistory(java.lang.Long placeId,
                                                                    java.lang.Long searchStartDate,
                                                                    java.lang.Long searchEndDate)
This function returns the events that were associated with a place in a given period. It searches for events that are associated with a place or a subplace of that place (upto one level). This function can be modified to search for places at more than one level.

Parameters:
place_id - Place Id for the place at which event are to be searched
startTime - Start Time for the search period converted to a long value
endTime - End time for the search period coverted to a long value
Returns:
Returns a vector of associated event id's (Long).

getNearbyEvents

public java.util.Vector getNearbyEvents(java.lang.Long placeId,
                                        java.lang.Long distanceToPlace)
This function return events that are with a fixed distance of a place. The distance between the event and the place is the distance between the centroid of the home place and the place where the event is held

Parameters:
placeId - We search for events close to place given by this paramter
distance - The places should be within distance given by this parameter
Returns:
It returns a vector that has eventId's and distances of the close events discovered and the distance to these events. The object is "NearbyEvent" Note here that the distance to place is converted from a double to string because KSOAP does not support double values

getNearbyEvents

public java.util.Vector getNearbyEvents(long placeId,
                                        long distanceToEvent)
This function return events that are with a fixed distance of a place. The distance between the event and the place is the distance between the centroid of the home place and the place where the event is held

Parameters:
placeId - We search for events close to place given by this paramter
distance - The places should be within distance given by this parameter
Returns:
It returns a vector that has eventId's and distances of the close events discovered and the distance to these events

getNearbyPlaces

public java.util.Vector getNearbyPlaces(java.lang.Long placeId,
                                        java.lang.Long distanceToPlace)
This is KSOAP compatible version of the main API. This function return places that are with a fixed distance of a place. The distance between two places is the distance between thier centroids.

Parameters:
placeId - We search for places close to place given by this paramter
distanceToPlace - The places should be within distance given by this parameter
Returns:
A vector of objects (KVMNearbyPlace) that contain placeId'd and distance to places, for the discovered places. Note here that the distance to place is coverted from a double to string because KSOAP does not support double values

getNearbyPlaces

public java.util.Vector getNearbyPlaces(long placeId,
                                        long distanceToPlace)
This function return places that are with a fixed distance of a place. The distance between two places is the distance between thier centroids.

Parameters:
placeId - We search for places close to place given by this paramter
distance - The places should be within distance given by this parameter
Returns:
It returns a vector that has placeId's of the close places discovered and the distance to these places. The information is stored in an object called "NearbyPlace"
